inn1.comm: chases a shortish delivery away from the body, and places it to the right of point for a single
short of a length, straight, tucked away off the hip for another single
wide length ball, shapes away, left alone
another wide full ball, left alone again
short of a length, angling in, defended to leg
he pushes this full outside off, and gets some swing. Rohit hangs his bat out there, and edges it wide of the diving slip. What if there was a second slip
short of a length, angling in, defended in front of off
wide of the crease, full, angling in, defended solidly back to him
that's a beauty. Short of a length, pitched outside off, Rohit plays for the angle, but the ball holds its line and kicks at him. Beaten
into the ribs, tucked away around the corner
tucked away off the hip for a single. That's what Dhawan has done to both the deliveries he has played
quick short ball, angling in, about rib high, Sharma defends, but the ball almost bounces back onto the stumps. Saved there, but not by much
short of a length, middle and off, angling away, Dhawan pushes inside the line of it. That's a Trescothick-style leave
slightly fuller, gets good carry through to Ramdin. Left alone outside off
full, just outside off, defended with an open face
pushed up full outside off, left alone again
this one shapes back in a little, Dhawan flicks it nicely, but can't beat square leg
short of a length, angling away, the extra bounce beats Dhawan's cut
short, no sting in it this time, and he pulls this over midwicket from the crease. No need to transfer the weight back either
short of a length, dropped to leg, and he runs through for a nicely judged single
length ball, on off, 138ks, angling away, left alone
top shot. A half-volley, at 141ks, on middle and off, he plays the check-drive, all along the ground, between the umpire and mid-off
flicked down the ground, to mid-on
uppish square drive, but superbly placed. He drives this one the up, doesn't make a conscious effort to keep it down, but has placed it right between short cover point and backward point
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
on a length, just outside off, the ball shapes away, and is left alone
short of a length, outside off, Rohit stands tall, and then lets it go through to Ramdin
full and straight, Rohit is a little early into the forward defensive, is hit on the outside half of the bat
wide half-volley, at 125ks, easily push-driven through cover for four. That was a hit-me delivery, and he caressed it
short of a length, outside off, defended from the crease
short of a length, middle and off, Dhawan covers the stumps and lets it angle away
length ball, just outside off, left alone
fuller, wider, left alone again
short of a length, pitched outside leg, defended back to him
length ball, on off, defended from the crease
a loose drive outside off, the ball goes off the outside half to point, but along the ground
full and on the stumps, defended to mid-on
angling down the leg side, Rohit picks it off his hips and places it fine of the square leg fielder
little away movement, defended back to the bowler off the back foot
Loose shot. It was well wide of the stumps, but Dhawan goes for his favourite cover drive and misses it completely. Lucky not to get an edge
Tighter line and Dhawan leaves it alone, watching it all the way to the keeper's gloves
angled outside off and Dhawan throws his bat at it. No timing there as mid-off fields it
Full on the off stump and its defended back to the bowler
And there's the properly timed square drive. It was full and angling away and Dhwan places this to the left of short point and it races off to the boundary
on the stumps and pushed to point.
And now its the cover drive. Gets onto the front foot and pierces it through the off side field. Nobody moved.
Roach corrects his line, but Dhawan flicks it off his pads in front of square
back to outside off stump and Dhawan wants nothing to do with it. Left alone
Good lift for that ball. But it was too far outside the off stump to interest Rohit
good length ball, just outside off and Rohit comes forward confidently to defend it out to the covers
Seam for Sammy. Ball shapes away and Rohit, mindful of that fact, leaves it alone
full on the stumps and its defended down the ground
Half volley on outside off again and Rohit opens the face to put the ball wide of the fielder at cover.
This one's better. On a length and Rohit dead bats it down the ground
Good length ball on the off stump. Dhawan dabs it into the off side and calls through for a quick single
shorter ball, outside off and Rohit leaves it alone
Full on the stumps. Rohit's drive only takes the outside half of the bat and goes to the covers
Good effort from Pollard. It was punched to point and the big man dives to his left to cut that one off
Punched to point. Replay of the last ball but this one doesn't need Pollard's acrobatic efforts.
outside off and shortish. He goes back and defends it safely
full, outside off, left alone
looks to drive, but the ball is a little slow for his shot, and ends up checking it back to Sammy
driven on the up, to deep cover for a single
short, wide, cut away, but can't beat Pollard at point
short of a length, outside off, defended to cover-point
tucked away off the hip for a single to deep square leg
a tip and run. He stands tall to a shortish ball, drops it at his feet, and runs across
and as we were talking about the slowness, here's Best at 147ks. Hits Dhawan's thigh pad, and goes for four leg-byes
misdirected again. A big wide down leg. Dhawan tries his best to guide this fine, but can't make a connection
length ball, on off, defended to cover
length ball, on the pads, flicked away, but in the air, and past midwicket
short of a length, on off, left alone to angle across
bouncer, 140ks, but called wide. That has gone over the leg stump, but it is the square-leg umpire who has signalled a wide to the main umpire. I am not too sure it was that high
short of a length, 149ks, beats the bat, hits him in the thigh. Dhawan is not showing too much of pain. Must have hit him on the guard
full, just outside off, defended off the front foot
short, 127ks, pulled away wide of deep square, takes a couple
short of a length, widish, nicely steered away to third man for one
length ball, wide outside off, beats his drive, but is called wide

full, on off, driven with an open face, mis-hit to point, they risk a single, and oh boy what happened here? The bat inverted in Dhawan's hand, and he tried to slide it in with the handle facing the ground. The bat handle made first contact with the ground. Thankfully for him, Pollard's throw missed
loose shot outside off. Beaten
defended to cover, wide of the fielder, gets a single
bouncer, that's sharp, on the stumps, Sharma ducks under it
short of a length, outside off, punched away to third man for one
quick length ball, angling away, he drives at it, gets a thick edge through the unpopulated gully region for a single
full, quick, angling in, defended to mid-off
short of a length, 146ks, lets out a big grunt. Defended in front of the stumps
short, wide, stays low, beats his cut
short of a length, on the pads, tucked away for a single
short of a length, Sharma goes for the cut, is beaten by the extra bounce
short and wide again, upper-cuts this, deliberately goes over point. Gets four for it
fuller now, straying down leg, concedes a leg-bye
half-volley, on off, driven to mid-off
short of a length, outside off, steered away to third man
short of a length, not too wide, but Dhawan has played a superb cut shot. Not so good for Narine, who is slow at third man, and lets this go through. A mix of timing and slow fielding here
what a bouncer. Not too short, but at 148ks, it goes head high for Dhawan, and he sways out of the line well. And then smiles in acknowledgement
short of a length, 146ks, on off, looks to open the face and take the single, but he has timed it too well to point
another good bouncer, this time it is 137ks, but is head high again. Dhawan bends his legs, sways away from its line. Both batsman and bowler stare at each other
short of a length, on the pads, Dhawan off the strike with a leg-bye
full and straight, pushed straight to Roach at mid-on for a sharp single. Sharma looks like he is struggling, but Roach's throw goes over the stumps
flighted on off, defended off the back foot
offbreak, a little too short, easily played to midwicket
another offbreak, but a little short, and punched back to Narine
Sharma picks his shot well. A bit of Mahela to this. He knows there is no deep square leg, and he sweeps this from outside off, and over the man in the circle
flighted on off, defended to leg
sharp offbreak, but a little too short, and defended to cover
half-volley, outside off, driven wide of mid-off, and Best makes a diving save
down the wicket, nowhere near this wide ball, but he manages to time this square-drive well. Beats point, but Narine is slow at the fence again
Dhawan out of the crease again, but this time he is beaten on the drive
and Dhawan dabs this shortish ball through gully for one
wide down the leg side
looks to cut this widish ball, gets a thick edge wide of the lone slip
short of a length, angling in, pushed wide of midwicket
tossed up on middle and leg, defended with an open face
pitched outside leg, turning towards leg, defended to leg

too clever by half. Bravo from slip runs towards leg slip as Dhawan shapes up to paddle this. This is illegal movement, but no umpire stops is nowadays. However, Dhawan doesn;t make a good connection. or any, according to the umpire, and the ball goes straight through where slip would have been. I thought there was an edge, but it is called byes
flighted, straight, blocked back
sharp turn and bounce, beats him outside off
shimmies down the track to defend this
full, on off, hits the inside half of the bat
short of a length, on off, punched to deep cover
short of a length, dabbed to point
driven on the up, wide of deep cover
down the leg side, Sammy is lucky Dhawan doesn't get a touch on it
Dhawan again. he advances down the wicket, is nowhere near the pitch of the ball, but drives it on the up, and in the air, through extra cover for four
length ball, middle and leg, defended back to him
flighted outside off, defended back to Narine
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
short of a length, pitches outside leg, turns towards leg, defended back to him
mis-hits the sweep. This one stops a touch on him, and it goes to mid-on off the to end
tries the late cut this, but can't beat backward point
cut away to the left of backward point, gets a single
length ball, outside off, left alone
length, outside off, mis-hits this drive back to him
wide length ball, driven to the left of deep cover, gets a couple
short of a length, nicely back-cuts it to the left of third man, and comes back for a couple to bring up his fifty
length ball, middle and leg, defended back to him
steered away to third man, and keeps the strike
short, wide, cut away to deep point
flighted, middle and off, turning into the pads, placed between midwicket and square leg
what a flat-bat dismissal of the ball. Swept away powerfully for a parallel six over midwicket. He has taken this from off
another sweep for a six. This is top batting. Taken from just outside off, and sent over midwicket again. Slightly squarer than the previous shot
Narine drops this short, and Dhawan rocks back quickly to pull this to deep midwicket for four. This is destructive batting
and now he takes the single to keep the strike. Short again, bunted to off and he runs through

and Dhawan falls to his own confidence. He has shifted gears of late, and this time got a length ball on the pads, and naturally went to hit it. However, he hasn't budgeted for the deep square leg, and has holed out
short of a length, outside off, left alone
slightly full, wide outside off, left alone again
length ball, on off, defended to mid-off
short of a length, angling in, rising into the ribs. Defended with the bottom hand off
defended off the back foot again
paddled away to fine leg for one
short of a length, angling in, defended from the crease
short again, worked around the corner for a single to get off the mark
tossed up outside off, turns in to hit the inside half of the bat
quick and straight, defended back
driven to long-on for one
short of a length, into the pads, defended to leg
wide of the crease, angling in, defended to leg
driven nicely, misfielded by Sammy at cover to allow them the single
short of a length, outside off, drops it to the left of point for one
defended off the front foot
wide of the crease, full, fast, angling in, beats his drive, but Roach knows this is headed down leg
quick, just outside off, defended
looks to flick this full ball, inside-edges it into his pad
short of a length, turning in, defended to leg
looks to work this to leg, is hit high on the pad
flighted outside off, he pushes forward to place this wide of point for one
pulled away to deep midwicket
driven on the up, to deep cover for one
full, angling in, clipped away off the toe
length ball, angling in, hits the inside half of the bat
driven uppishly, to deep cover, gets a single
short, looks to tuck him, but it is down leg. All but Ramdin go for a big appeal for a catch down leg. No touch. Called wide
short of a length, widish, punched on the up, wide of extra cover, all along the ground. Gets four for it
full, turning in, clipped away for a single
short of a length, turning in, punched to mid-on
flat, quick, hits the inside edge onto the pad
quick again, he makes room to guide this wide of point
tossed up wide, defended off the front foot
down the wicket to push this shortish ball to long-on for one

another fast bowler comes back and takes a wicket first ball of the new spell. Seems to have been done in by the line and the pace. Backs away to try to back-cut a length ball that is not too wide, and Best takes the edge gleefully
short, into the ribs, gets inside the line to drop this wide of leg gully for one
short of a length, into the pads, 143ks, defended to midwicket
shortish again, towards the chest, fended off the toe
rising towards the chest, this time he rides the bounce, and dabs it to third man
oh ho ho Raina. He is expecting the bouncer. Best bowls full. Somehow he gets the bat down, and midwicket dives over it to allow the single
No feet there. He just stays rooted to the crease and dabs it out square on the off side
Lots of feet this time. Comes down the track and gives it a full swing. The ball sails over the long on boundary.
full on the off stump and its pushed out to the off side
on the stumps, he goes forward and defends it down the pitch
makes a little room there and carves it out to point
defended straight down the ground
Good pace. Over 148ks. And Kohli's a little late on that one, but the pull shot does reach deep midwicket for an easy couple
Mistimes again. This time its outside the off stump and Kohli goes for the cut and the ball rolls away to point
Short ball. He moves across to the off side and hooks it down through square leg
He's building a lot of pace. This one's 148 ks. It goes off the inside half of the bat to the leg side
Flicked off his hips after moving well across the stumps again. Easy single through vacant square leg
Outside off on a good length and Kohli leaves it alone
Tossed up from Samuels and Raina reaches forward and drives it back to the bowler
Gone! Good catch from at slip. Raina opens the face of the bat and the ball runs off the face and straight into Sammy's hands
On the pads and Karthik tries to work it away to get off the mark and only manages a leading edge
He rocks back and flays this square through the off side. Powerful cut shot races away to the boundary
Short ball. He gets back behind the line but the ball takes the outside half of the bat and goes out to point
Wayward from Best. Its well down the leg side and comfortably beats Kohli's intended pull down to fine leg
Well done at fine leg. Best sprays it down leg again and he swivels around on his back foot and pulls it down to fine leg. The fielder displays good desperation and limits it to just one
Short and outside off. Good ball. Good lift. Karthik leaves it alone
Beauty. Karthik is rooted to the crease and this one seams away late, beating his outside edge. Looks like Best is getting his radar back
Shortish and at the body. Karthik gets behind it and defends it down the ground
And Best varies it up. Fuller ball now and Karthik's drive takes doesn't have any timing as the ball goes down to long-on
Around off stump and he pushes it back to the bowler
And out come Kohli's wrists. Flighted ball from Samuels and Kohli moves on to his front foot and flicks it away through midwicket
turns it down square on the leg side
On the stumps again and Kohli turns it to the on side again
Oh, close. Kohli goes back and gets the bat down in time as that ball was on target to take off stump
Inside edge from Kohli, but the ball trickles safely away from the stumps

and a wicket with the first ball of the Powerplay. Dug in short, down the leg side, Ramdin collects after Karthik tries to pull. Ramdin hardly appeals, but Best does heartily, and it is given. Karthik is not happy, and it doesn't seem to have hit the glove. There is a clear case for show of dissent. Even Kohli looks very angry
and what a welcome he gets. Super fast short ball, he doesn't even look at it, and is hit on the shoulder
short and quick again, hits his glove, goes for a run. Vijay will be relieved
short, doesn't rise too high, pulled away, wide of that deepish short leg. Vijay will want to see that closely
full, on off, pushed to mid-on with the angle
short of a length, on off, stays back to work this to leg. Straight to midwicket
full, middle and leg, pushed to long-on for one
short of a length, outside off, goes back to cut this through point for four
on a length, on off, lets it turn, and pushes it to long-on
full, into the pads, defended to short midwicket
down the wicket, makes room, pushes this to long-on for another single
full and fast, dug out to cover
easy runs there. Vijay needed it. Full, down the leg side, a half-volley, and nicely glanced away fine of fine leg
short of a length, rising towards the chest, fended off the toe
short, with two men deep on the leg side, pulled to deep square leg
short, chest high, just outside off, he pulls this dismissively through midwicket
short of a length again, runs this down square on the off side for a single
short of a length, into the pads, nicely clipped away for a single
flighted, middle and off, defended back to him
beautiful shot. Vijay has style. Tossed up outside off, he presses forward and chips this nicely over cover. Inside-out it goes
pulls the length back, Vijay makes room to cut this from outside leg, but can;t beat cover-point
quick length ball, outside off, he plants the front foot down and paddles this fine of short fine leg
half-volley, driven wide of mid-off for a single
flat length ball, looks to open the face, but the ball turns more than expected, and he has to defend
and Vijay is dictating terms here. Makes room never mind where the ball pitches, and sends this shortish ball crashing through extra cover
Vijay is expecting and is ready for a short ball, gets inside the line, and pulls it over short fine leg for four more
slower ball, on a length, on the pads, worked away for a single to leg
on a length, angling in, pushed away to one

and Pollard lets a roar out after getting Vijay out. Vjay backs away again, gets a short ball, wants to cut it over the square field on the off side. The ball, though, stops on him, and he ends up cutting it straight to point. Pollard punches the air
defended off the front foot
length ball, outside off, 143ks, pushed to cover-point
bouncer, rising towards the head, but Kohli pulls, and clears midwicket. Not the best of connections but enough to clear the infield
short of a length, angling, pushed to the right of midwicket. Substitute Devon Smith makes a diving save
short, quick, Jadeja is hustled into opening the face, but it flies wide of the diving point
pushed to the right of deep cover, and steals the second
lovely square-drive. Quick length ball, but gives him width, and Kohli drives with an open face, past the diving Gayle at point
looks to smash a length ball out of here, hits this to mid-off on the bounce
Pollard has nearly pulled off a blinder. Cut to the right of point, Pollard dives, maybe a little too far, and is hit on the wrist
dabbed away to third man for one
slower ball, driven straight to cover, Jadeja wants one, Kohli doesn't. Jadeja is sent back, substitute Devon Smith lobs the ball back to Bravo, and Jadeja is caught short
bouncer, Kohli misses the pull, is beaten
short again, this time Kohli gets inside the line to pull it to fine leg for one
short of a length, down the leg side, called a wide
superb square drive again. Using Best's pace. On the up, driven with an open face, past point
slower ball, 127ks, pushed with an open face, takes the single to bring up his fifty
short of a length, on off, defended to leg
dug in short, but down the leg side. Best appeals, but it is rightly called wide as it doesn't touch Ashwin's glove
full and wide, Ashwin looks to push at it, but is beaten
gets inside the line to work this to leg for a single
full, on the toes, clipped away wide of deep square. Comes back for two. Best has bowled out
length ball, outside leg, Ashwin doesn't get a touch. Called a wide
sower ball, outside off, runs off the high part of the bat for a single
and a shorter ball. Too short in fact. Wide for height. Twenty-first extra
steered away to the right of third man for a couple
that's filthy bowling. Short, slow, outside leg, and has been pulled square of fine leg for four
pulled to deep midwicket for one
slower ball, pushed to short cover
slower length ball, on the pads, worked away for one
short of a length, into the pads, worked to leg
quick, fired in, pushed to midwicket
slower, but short, and is worked past cover for one
full and fast, a yorker, dug out by Kohli
short, quick, Kohli picks the length early and rocks back to pull this through square leg for four
full toss, and Kohli drives with an open face, wide of long-off for four more. Kohli is keeping India alive again
and begins with a huge wide down the leg side. Saw Ashwin back away, but Ashwin didn't go on with the movement
length ball, outside off, pushed to the right of point
pulled down the ground for six. This is lovely timing and muscle. Short, sitting up, he doesn't look to go square. Just slaps it over long-on's head
slower ball, short, worked away for one
slower short ball, Ashwin drops it to off, and hands over the strike to Kohli
down the wicket, plays the check shot to the slower ball. The ball goes uppishly, but bounces short of mid-off
slower short ball again, pulled away to deep backward square leg
down the wicket to drive this shortish ball to third man for one
gets inside the line of a short ball to tuck it to leg and hand over the strike to the captain
slower ball, big wide down the leg side. Kohli wants to hit it, but can't reach it
short of a length, outside off, he backs away to try to clear extra cover. Beaten by the extra bounce
slower ball again, Kohli doesn;t pick it, gets a bottom edge on the drive outside off
another slow ball, Kohli has picked it and smashed it out of his presence. Smacked over short leg. A whip-pull, if you will
short of a length, bunted into the leg side, keeps the strike

this will not help their over rate. This is a crazy little shot. Kohli is on fire here. This is a back-foot drive over extra cover and into the second tier. Backs away, plants the weight on the back foot, and almost chips this over extra cover
this time he has driven it straight to extra cover
length ball, middle and leg, worked away for one
short, on the body, pulled away nicely. Ashwin shows he bats too
Ashwin goes from strength to strength. Down the wicket, and drives this length ball through point for four
short of a length, outside off, dabs on it, places it wide of deep point. Roach makes a diving save there
where are the yorkers? Bowlers, please. Don;t bowl short to Kohli at the end of an ODI innings. He picks it, doesn't matter he is on front foot, and he pulls it wide of long-on for four more
length ball, into the pads, concedes a leg-bye
bouncer again. Ashwin is backing away, tries to upper-cut it, gets a bit of an edge, but that's twice as nice as it goes fine of third man
short again, hip-high, pulled away for a single to bring up India's 300
what a sublime shot. Roach finally tries the yorker, but Kohli dances down the track, and takes this on the full, and drives it between cover and extra cover. All along the ground
a leg-bye to end the over as this is angled in
full toss, on the pads, flicked away to deep midwicket
Kohli has to dive in to stay alive. It is predecided that Ashwin is going to push and run. However, he pushes it back to the bowler, and Kohli has to dive in full length

and there it is. Captain Kohli scores his 14th ODI century. Pushed wide of deep midwicket, comes back for the second, and leaps in the air after crossing the stumps. Then pats himself on the back with his bat. He is pumped
full, on the pads, whipped away for a single
looks to make room, gets a bottom edge on this for a single
Kohli falls, but to the final ball of the innings. He gets a length ball, tries to clear deep midwicket, but can't. Just doesn't get the elevation on this. Kohli has done the job, though

inn2.comm: swing back into Gayle first up. Defended to short midwicket
wide length ball, Gayle goes chasing, is beaten
this stops at him, and Gayle is completely done in. Put it down to the heavy blade that this check shot, a complete mis-hit, has cleared point
short of a length, outside off, left alone
short of a length, wide, called this time
short of a length, middle and leg, defended off the back foot. Skiddy delivery
short of a length, outside off, kept out. Skiddy again
starts with an outswinger, middle and off, moving to off, goes off the outside half for one
short of a length, wide, beats the cut
straighter this time, punched down to mid-off
full outside off, Gayle stands tall and drives. Finds mid-off
that's a good bouncer. Not too short, 143ks, and he gets it to rise enough to beat Gayle's hook. Gayle wants a wide call, but this is merely called one for the over. I am with the umpire here
this is the limp short ball. Waist high. And Gayle has dismissed it from his presence
short of a length, skids through to hit him possibly between the pad and thigh pad. Hobbles through for a leg-bye
short, outside off, Charles wants to pull, but the low bounce skids under his bat
short of a length, wide, punched, on the up, between point and cover-point

And Bhuvneshwar provides a breakthrough in his first spell again. There is a drizzle in the air, but it doesn't affect BK's seam. The ball lands on the seam, short of a length, just outside off, and it breaks away and kicks a little. Gayle cannot control it, and edges it through. Outside the playing field, Dhoni applauds too
this one moves back in from off, Bravo gets a thick inside edge onto the pad. Oh, my bad. It is pad first, but the impact is well outside off
this one goes with the angle, and is left alone
short of a length, outside off, left alone
short of a length, on off, punched to cover-point
bouncer, Charles wants to duck, but the ball stays low and he has to sway out of its line
short, outside off, he leaves it alone
crunched away. Too many short balls, and Charles stands tall to pull this from well outside off, and in front of square
wide down the leg side. The first ball he pitches up this over
on a length, on off, holds its line, sort of squared up in defence
short, wide, but Charles doesn't go after it
short of a length, outside off, left alone to swing away
short of a length, angling in, defended from the back foot
dabbed away behind square for a single
shout for lbw, made to look worse by Charles who is playing across the line. Going down, though
looking London, going Tokyo. Charles swings hard at a length ball, gets a thick edge over the slips
full, into the pads, pushed wide of mid-on for one

look at where Bravo is looking, and look where the ball is. He plonks the front foot down and wants to drive this wide of mid-off, but is nowhere near this length ball, and edges it to Ashwin for a comfortable catch at first slip. All through, Bravo is looking towards extra cover
short of a length, holds its line, left alone
this is going down leg, and Charles wants to leave it alone, but the ball holds its line after pitching, and hits him on the thigh pad
full, outswinger, just outside off, Charles pushes without feet, and is beaten
short of a length, on off, Charles stands tall to defend
full, on the pads, but gets away with it as the flick finds Dhawan at square leg
short-arm pull. Yadav pitches short, and although there isn't much room to swing his arms, Charles manages to pull it in front of square
length ball, on off, Samuels moves across to defend
short of a length, outside off, left alone
full, middle and leg, clipped to mid-on
short of a length, on off, defended back to him
short of a length, Samuels stays back to defend
beauty. Short of a length, outside off, Samuels plays for the angle, but the ball seams away to beat the edge
short of a length, angling in, it goes off the thigh pad for one leg-bye
moves across to a shortish delivery. He is right in front of the stumps, but bat comes down just in time, and the inside edge goes for four to fine leg
short of a length, outside off, moves across to defend
short of a length and straight again, defended from the crease
wide down the leg side. The ball swings posthumously to give Karthik some grief
on a length, on off, defended off the back foot
short of a length, outside off, defended with an open face
short of a length, cut away to square third man
length ball outside off, pushed to cover
into the pads this goes, worked away to fine leg
short of a length, angling in, worked to leg
oh what a shot. That sound of the bat was crisp. Like a "kluck". Stands tall, clears the front leg, takes shortish ball and sends it sailing over wide long-on
short of a length, outside off, dabbed away for one
Charles is unleashing some incredible shots here. Nowhere close to the pitch of this length ball, but he drives, on the up, and back over the bowler's head. Lands on the rope on the full
short, just outside off, he pulls, and he pulls well, past square leg for four
and now the upper-cut. Not much room, hence not timed very well, and takes the single
this one seams back in, Samuels gets an inside edge onto the thigh pad
short of a length, angling in, called a wide for being down leg
short of a length, on off, defended off the back foot
dug short outside off, left alone
short of a length, outside off, Charles looks to square-drive, and is beaten
slower ball, on a length, wide, and Charles sends this crashing over straight extra cover. Charles needs no warm-up
another slower ball, angling into the pads, defended to leg
short of a length, just outside off, punched to cover-point
slower short ball, flick-pulled away, but gets only a single because of the slowness of the ball
short of a length, outside off, moves across to defend this to cover-point
short of a length, outside off, punched away to deep cover
moves across to a fullish ball, then bunts it to leg for one
slower ball, down the leg side, Sharma is lucky the ball has kissed the pad on the way through
short of a length, outside off, steered away to third man for one

what a beauty from Sharma. He has bowled this jaffa out of nowhere. Short of a length, kicks away, seams away, Samuels wants to get out of the way, but seems to have gloved it. Huge appeal from India, but the umpire is unmoved
and it doesn't matter what happened last ball. Sharma has his man. Short of a length again, seams a touch again, and this time Samuels has clearly edged it. Sharma is pumped
slower ball outside off, beats him on the drive
short of a length, angling in, punched back at him
clears his front leg to drive this to long-off for one

one more bites the dust. Golden duck for Pollard. Pace and bounce here. Short of a lenght, rising towards the chest, Pollard arches back and jabs at it. Ashwin takes another catch at slip. Have India found a slip catcher? And more importantly, a place for Ashwin?
short of a length, angling in, defended in front of off
wide length ball, left alone
bouncer, outside off, Charles pulls under the ball, and is beaten
top shot. Short again, but wide this timer, and he has upper-cut it over point for four

another short ball gets India a wicket. This is surreal. Indian fans won't mind this at all, though. Short again, rising towards the chest again, handcuffs him on the pull, and square leg runs to his right to judge the catch well
short of a length, outside off, defended off the back foot
squares him up by straightening a little. Short of a length again
that has hit him in the unmentionables. Short of a length, outside off, jags back in sharply, and gets him smack on the box. Bravo is doubling up in pain
defended off the back foot
length ball outside off, holds its line, beats the edge
beaten outside off again as this one holds its line too
this ball is doing crazy things. Both balls actually. Jags back in from short of a length, and hits him high on the bat. Ramdin has to take the bottom hand off
holds its line this time, half-squares him up as he defends
this one angles in, and is worked away to fine leg
tucked away off the hip for a single
short of a length, outside off, defended from the crease
nicely played. Gets across the line, takes this from outside off, flicks this wide of mid-on. Bravo still feeling the pain of that hit
short of a length, outside off, defended off the back foot
flicked away from the leg-stump line, gets a single to backward square leg
more extra bounce, and he has to fend this to off
length ball, on off, defended to cover
slight turn away, left alone outside off
punched past point for a single
tossed up outside off, slower through the air, draws Ramdin into the drive, and beats him
slightly shorter, but still not too short. Defended off the front foot
huge never-ending appeal for lbw. Pitches middle and leg, but has it straightened enough. Umpire Llong doesn't think so. And he is right
short of a lenght, gets turn, nudged to backward short leg
this one doesn't turn, pushed to cover for one, and Jadeja nearly takes Karthik out with a bullet throw
driven down the ground as this is pitched too full
pushes forward, seems to have get an inside edge onto the pad, but there is no forward short leg
flat length ball, worked away into the leg side
clipped wide of mid-on
flat, quick, some turn, defended back to him
this one doesn't turn, and is defended to leg
tossed up, hits the outside half of the bat, gets a single to backward point
outside edge on a quick delivery, and goes wide of the slip
and Ramdin sweeps. The release shot. And he has connected well, and placed it through square leg
tossed up on off, defended to cover
short of a length, outside off, pushed back to him
flighted, quick still, played back to him
on a length, pitched outside leg, angling towards off, defended to midwicket
short of a length, defended to square leg
mis-hit for six. Bravo rocks back to pull, gets too much under the ball, but he has got enough bat on it to clear deep square leg
offbreak, starts outside off, defended back to him

and Yadav strikes first ball. A straight full ball, angling in, Ramdin is slightly early into this on-side shot, and the leading edge carries to the left of mid-off, who has enough time to come under it
another leading edge. Sammy looks to work to leg, ends up playing to point. Again the ball just comes on a touch slow after pitching
finally worked away into the leg side for a couple
sconed him. Darren, get a new helmet. This one rises a touch extra, beats the top edge, beats him for pace too. Hits the peak of the helmet. Sammy keeps the helmet
Yadav tries the old one-two, but the full one is too straight, and goes for four leg-byes. Had this been on off, it would have been interesting
down the pads again, and goes for four more leg-byes
short, outside off, punched away to deep cover
Sammy goes at this with hard hands, ends up mis-hitting it to point, but on the bounce
Sammy is out to entertain. What flair in that shot. Gets under a length ball, drives inside-out, but in the air, and over cover
flat outside off, left alone
turn and bounce. Sammy presses forward, and is beaten
left alone outside off this time
short of a length, 136ks, on off, defended to leg
strays down the leg side. Lucky to have touched the pad on the way

stays low, skids through, jags back in from outside off, beats the inside edge, and is given out lbw. I think it is headed down leg, but I am waiting for a replay. And I am wrong. bravo had moved too far across, and was dead plumb
full, into the pads, clipped to square leg
defended off the back foot
stays low as he has left this alone outside off. Beats Karthik, but also misses the helmet placed behind him
angling in, short of a length, defended off the front foot
length ball, holds its line in front of off, defended to cover
quicker delivery, takes the outside half of the bat, and goes to point
flat length, ball, defended off the front foot
slows this one down, hit back to him
slower, slightly short, takes a soft edge, and falls short of slip. That is a one-minute maiden, I think
that's a slap. Sammy wanted to attack no matter where this pitched. This was short of a lenght, but he has smacked this straight of mid-on for four
stays short of a length, outside off, defended off the back foot

slower offcutter, and Yadav has three wickets in three overs. Sammy is not too pleased. He thinks this is cutting too much, but umpire Llong says it is hitting the stumps. And he is right again. Sammy completely done in by the change of pace, and the movement off the track
short of a length, outside off, left alone
length ball, on off, angling away, left alone again
short of a length, just outside off, defended to point
dropped. Gets Roach's edge, hits Karthik's glove, and the ricochet goes between the slip and the gully
angled into the pads, worked away into the leg side
Roach hits a six. He just clears his throat and swings, and goes with the turn and over long-off
flat, outside off, left alone
Roach gets four more. This is dragged too short, and is wide too. Punched away through cover
full and straight, gets the edge from Roach, but it goes straight down and bounces in front of slip, and goes between slip and gully
flat, angling in, nicely defended
fuller, angling in, defended
heaved away into the leg side for two
Narine down the wicket, makes room, goes with the turn, inside-out, over extra cover. Top shot
carrom ball, Narine doesn;t pick it, is hit high on the pad. Appeal for lbw but this seams headed down leg. Turning too much
offbreak now, picked and defended off the back foot
short of a length, immediately extra bounce, defended to point
punched on the up, crisply hit, but Rohit Shamra makes a diving save at cover to help the fellow Sharma
tucked away off the hip for one
wide down the leg side. Too big wide
short of a length, straight, defended back to him
loose drive to a shortish delivery outside off. Beaten
short of a length, pitched outside leg, defended off the back foot
Roach has smoked this. Slog-sweeps this offbreak clean out of the ground, over midwicket
carrom ball, and he seems to have read it as he defends off the back foot
legbreak, defended off the back foot
shorter, flatter, Roach wants to pull, but the edge clears backward short leg
tossed up on off, driven to long-off for one
carrom ball, pitches outside leg, defended in front of off
Narine tries a back-foot drive on the up to a shortish delivery, and is beaten by the extra bounce
nicely punched on the up, but finds cover
short of a length, on off, defended back to him
stays short of a length, just outside off, and is left alone
slightly fuller, straight, defended in front of off
right behind the shortish ball again, and defends well
full, down the leg side, worked away to deep square
full and wide, there is a noise as the ball passes the bat, but it is the bat hitting the ground
length ball, just outside off, Narine wants to punch it, but is beaten
punched away on the up, but straight to mid-off
dug in short, he fends with both feet in the air, and gets a single around the corner
yorker, middle and leg, Roach stays back to dug it out for one
length ball, on off, swept away, over midwicket, gets a flat four
short of a length, flat, punched away to deep cover for one
length ball, turning in, defended to leg
short, turning in, cramps him up. Defended to off

Narine is missed this time. He is down the wicket, gets too much under the ball, and lofts it towards long-on. Bhuvneshwar and Raina are both calling for it but neither of them is listening, and at the last moment they both pull out of it. Both have misjudged it
and now Narine rubs it in by jumping down the wicket and lofting him for a six over long-on
short, outside off, he flashes, and is beaten
short, Roach moves across to get inside the line, and pulls it fine of fine leg for four more. Now they need 54 to avoid the bonus point
big wide down the leg side. Well done to Karthik to keep the damage down to just one with a full-length dive
another wide. This bouncer is clearly way too high
heaves at a length ball outside off, gets an inside edge onto the pad
slower ball, he covers the off-stump line and opens the face late to get a single
slower ball again, and Narine is solid in defence
short of a lenght, outside off, punched away for a single to point. The bonus-point-avoiding target now comes down to 50
short of a length, turning in, defended to leg
down the wicket to try the big loft, gets an inside edge to short fine leg
short of a length, outside off, punched to extra cover
pulled away to deep midwicket for one
finally India get a wicket. Finally Narine falls. He makes room, tries to go over cover, but he doesn't have that much space to swing, and finds long-off
Jadeja finishes it off. India claim the bonus point. This is full and straight, Roach plays across the line, is hit on the pad, and then on the stumps
